abstract: United Rusal’s application for a $2 billion initial public offering on Hong Kong’s stock exchange received approval from the bourse and the securities regulator, allowing the world’s largest aluminum producer to become the first Russian company to list in the territory.
snippet: United Rusal’s application for a $2 billion initial public offering on Hong Kong’s stock exchange received approval from the bourse and the securities regulator, allowing the world’s largest aluminum producer to become the first Russian company to...
lead_paragraph: United Rusal‘s application for a $2 billion initial public offering on Hong Kong’s stock exchange received approval from the bourse and the securities regulator, allowing the world’s largest aluminum producer to become the first Russian company to list in the territory.

headline.main: Rusal I.P.O. Said to Get Approval in Hong Kong
